title: Andy Maxwell
text:
Andy Maxwell is a former <a href="Ireland">Irish</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player, previously of <a href="Ulster">Ulster</a> and <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh Rugby</a>. He joined the <a href="Ulster%20rugby">Ulster</a> squad at the start of the <a href="2003-04%20Celtic%20League">2003-04 season</a> and made his Ulster debut against <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh Rugby</a> in September 2004 which he capped with a try.
Maxwell won his first Ireland A cap at the <a href="2006%20Churchill%20Cup">2006 Churchill Cup</a> tournament in the <a href="United%20States">U.S.</a> and <a href="Canada">Canada</a>. He won two caps with appearances against the <a href="United%20States%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">USA</a> and <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand Maori</a>. He has also represented Ireland at Sevens, U21, U19 and U18 levels. His speed and style of rugby is well suited to the <a href="Rugby%20sevens">seven aside game</a> and he took part in the <a href="Rugby%20World%20Cup%20Sevens">Rugby World Cup Sevens</a> tournament in Hong Kong in summer 2005. At the end of the 2006-07 season, Maxwell left Ulster and moved to Edinburgh Rugby.
In May 2008 Maxwell decided to pursue a career outside professional rugby and left <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh Rugby</a>. He and a number of other Irish professionals, such as Ross McCarron and <a href="Simon%20Hillary">Simon Hillary</a>, did this.
Maxwell is now a co-owner of the Irish burrito bar chain Boojum.
